item.title: Malaysia beat Thailand on away goals in Suzuki Cup semis - The Star Online
item.description:
Malaysia beat Thailand on away goals in Suzuki Cup semis  The Star Online

Malaysia is in the final of the AFF Suzuki Cup! Harimau Malaya, led by coach Tan Cheng Hoe, fought back to hold Thailand to a 2-2 draw in a pulsating affair at the Rajamangala Stadium in Bangkok on Dec 5 night. Malaysia were held 0-0 at the National Stadium in Bukit Jalil on Dec 1.

item.title: ‘Honda-powered’ Cambodia may know Malaysia better than expected - The Star Online
item.description:
‘Honda-powered’ Cambodia may know Malaysia better than expected  The Star Online

PETALING JAYA: Malaysia coach Tan Cheng Hoe is more concerned about Cambodia’s inside intel than their new Japanese coach Keisuke Honda when they meet in a friendly at the Phnom Penh National Olympic Stadium today. Terengganu midfielder Thierry Chantha Bin and former Negri Sembilan and PKNP players Prak Mony Udom and Keo Sokpheng are expected to spill the beans on Malaysian football to Honda. “I’m more concerned about the team than the coach. Some of them have been playing in the Malaysian League. On top of this, they will be motivated due to their new coach, and they will get the backing o...
